subject: Science
title: Weather Satellites
description: Learn Weather Satellites in one minute.

hook.text: In 1960, the first weather satellite sent back grainy images of clouds from space.

buildup.text: For the first time, meteorologists could see entire storm systems at once.

discovery.text: Geostationary satellites orbit at 36,000 km, watching the same spot continuously.

twist.text: Polar-orbiting satellites fly lower, scanning every point on Earth twice a day.

climax.text: Today, satellite data feeds directly into forecast models running on supercomputers.

punchline.text: We photograph Earth's weather from space every 10 minutes. That's why we trust forecasts.

quiz.question: What advantage did weather satellites give meteorologists?
options: The ability to see entire storm systems at once
Precise temperature readings on the ground
